meanings.definition: A distinct form or race of a plant or animal species occupying a particular habitat.
meanings.sent1: The ecotype of the bird in the forest has unique colors to blend in with the trees.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the ecotype of the fish living in the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The ecotype of the squirrel in the park seemed to have a preference for acorns.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the ecotype of the butterfly stood out with its vibrant wings.
meanings.sent5: The ecotype of the flower in the desert was perfectly adapted to survive with minimal water.

meanings.definition: A population of organisms that are adapted to a specific set of environmental conditions.
meanings.sent1: The ecotype of the bacteria in the hot spring thrived in extreme heat.
meanings.sent2: Researchers observed the ecotype of plants growing in saline soil.
meanings.sent3: The ecotype of the frogs in the pond seemed to enjoy the rainy weather.
meanings.sent4: The ecotype of the algae in the ocean played a crucial role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The ecotype of the cactus in the arid region had developed unique water-saving mechanisms.
